reviews.text: This was my 6th time staying at Hotel San Carlo . My visit to Rome was for 3 weeks from the middle of November up to Dec 7 . It is a very nice and clean hotel with an excellent location , right in the middle of many sights . The management and staff were very helpful and most delightful . The breakfast was more than ample and served on the roof terrace which was a new location and very pleasant .
reviews.title: " The place to stay "

reviews.text: Definitely the place to stay while in Rome !
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel for Central Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For anyone familiar or new to Rome, you know the hotels in the Eternal City can be the most expensive on your trip to Italy. We found this small hotel several years ago and have stayed there a number of times, now. It is perfectly located a block from Via del Corso and all the great places to walk within the city. There are lots of restaruants and cafe/bars in the area and they are not overrun by tourists, so you can enjoy some real Roman ambiance. The rooms are comfortable and clean, the bathrooms typical for older Roman hotels. The breakfast is typical, too, but a pleasant way to start the day. The staff is wonderful - helpful in directions, finding restaurants, and arranging transportation to the airport at ungodly hours. For location, this is a great value.
reviews.title: Perfect Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Rome and turned to Tripadvisor for help. We were delighted with this hotel. It is in a great location, near the Spanish Steps but far enough away that is is quiet and not congested. The room felt a little small at first but it was quite functional once we got settled. It was very clean and fresh feeling with a nice bathroom. The staff is wonderful, they couldn't be nicer. We especially appreciated Victoria, the manager who we called upon for all sorts of recommendations. Let her order the taxi for you to get back to the airport, you will be sure of the price that way. Breakfast was a lovely affair, it is upstairs on an outdoor terrace. It was a great way to start the day. There are many lovely shops, restaurants, and a supermarket within easy walking distance. Great to arrive back at the hotel after a long day and have such a choice within a few blocks. You will not be disappointed in this little gem of a hotel.
reviews.title: Great Value With One Flaw

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel if you are not a large person. It is perfectly located on a small alley just two blocks from the Spanish Steps, the staff is friendly and recommended some fabulous restaurants, the included continental breakfast is fresh and tasty, our room was quiet, clean and comfortable with a great bed. However our room had the world's smallest shower stall. I'm a pretty big guy at 6'1" & 240 pounds, and taking a shower was a major challenge because it was virtually impossible to move in the enclosure. We would definitely stay here again BUT only if we were able to get a larger shower.
reviews.title: It's all about location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small, traditional hotel near the Spanish Steps on Via delle Carroze, which runs between the Corso and the Steps. We had a nice room (by Roman hotel standards) -- small, but very comfortable. The hotel gets a lot of Americans and has adjusted its breakfast menu accordingly: meaning real coissants, not coronetti. What makes the place is the staff -- everyone was extremely warm and friendly and helpful, trying very hard to make your experience as easy and comfortable as possible. We loved them all !!! (Hi, Roseanna, Victoria, Dante ... and everyone!) We would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a place in the Spanish Steps neighborhood.
reviews.title: Nice room, friendly helpful staff

reviews.text: The hotel San Carlo was right by the Spanish steps and in the heart of all of the shopping. The staff was so friendly and helpful in getting cabs, handling luggage, and showing you around the city using their map. Great wifi and good sized rooms too. For not being in the room too long, there was plenty of space for our luggage. Breakfast could have had more options, compared to other places in Italy we have stayed but still good coffee and fruit and yogurt.
reviews.title: Great location and excellent service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have lost count of how many times we have stayed at the Hotel San Carlo. We usually stay in the same room so I can compare any changes since our last visit (which was in January 2012). The bathroom is now much brighter and "fresher" than before, there seem to be more and better towels and also a greater variety of bath amenities. The rooms are always very clean.
reviews.title: Even better than January

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is not a better located hotel in Rome. The staff is wonderful, helpful and very grateful for return visitors. They have a terrific English speaking driver, Gianni, who can meet you at the airport when you arrive or drop you off, in addition to taking you to places such as Tivoli gardens outside of Rome. The services they offer are far above a 3 star rated hotel.
reviews.title: Best Kept Secret in Rome!

reviews.text: Breakfast on the roof top terrace is a wonderful way to start the day. The fresh baked, warm croissants are delicious. There are many other options such as cereal, yogurt, rolls, cheese, lunch meats, sweets and fruit - plus any type of freshly made coffee or tea you want.
reviews.title: Wonderful, clean and excellent location
Very good location
reviews.text: Hotel is located in a prime spot and you can easily walk to all the major sites. Great shopping as well as wonderful restaurants in the neighborhood. I do agree that some of the rooms need more re-modeling. They have 2 buildings – one with an elevator and the other without an elevator. If you have problem with stairs, be sure to mention that you get a room in the other building. Staff was very helpful.
location, location, location. Booked a single on hotel website, 2 nights at 115 euros per night--after reading the reviews on this site.
reviews.title: march 29th and 30th 2007
Great Location, Good Hotel
reviews.text: When I checked in at 11:00 am they offered me room 21. Knowing this was a lower floor dog, I baulked and offered to wait. When I came back at 3, they gave me room 42, which is a tiny one on the back of the hotel with a great private terrace. Very quiet. Loved it. If you get a nice terrace , it makes a small room fine. bed was not as comfortable as the Sheraton Roma, but I loved this location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to a reception up the spanish steps at the Villa Medici. It's like disneyland for adults. The fired artichoke at Campana is mouth watering. It's not on the menu so make sure to ask for it.
reviews.title: quaint and perfect

reviews.text: While there, I looked at other rooms at the hotel: There is also a room with a King bed that I would book when I come back with my wife--photos now up on their website.
reviews.title: Fantastic for Family of Four!

reviews.text: We picked the HOtel San Carlo because of its terrific location. Our room was very basic, but that was OK. We only spent time there when we were sleeping and showering. The hotel staff was terrific. They were kind enough to carry our extremely heavy suitcases up to our room for us. The same women always was at the front desk and made calls to our limo service, gave us directions, etc. We also liked that we were very close to a great shopping area. Would I stay here again? You bet. Just keep in mind, this is not an American hotel.
reviews.title: Not too shabby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is nice if you want to be in the "Beverly Hills" shopping area...VERY touristy though...But most of central Rome is! The breakfast was basic rolls, sweat roll, cereal...Most breakfasts we had in Italy were nothing special and quite minimal compared to other countries in Europe... Our room was fairly good size but VERY run down...Cracked floor tiles...Chipped paint...Broken shower...Horrible uncomfortable mattress...But we ignored that thinking it was old Italian "charm"! Our main issue was the NOISE factor...We constantly heard room doors and a hotel entry doors slamming 24 hours a day...Also, I guess the windows are not dual paned/glazed...We could hear noise from the street below at ALL hours...motor cycles/scooters...people opening their stores at 6 AM!...Trash trucks banging at ALL hours...I've traveled to large cities hundreds of times (ie. NY,Paris,London,ETC...)and understand urban noise But this was not acceptable...On our 5th night we found an incredible room for less than half the price of San Carlo near Pzza Republica...Super clean/updated & quiet!...Also, the front desk workers are not very helpful at San Carlo even though we had a 5 night reservation...They of course brushed me off when I wanted a different room saying that nothing was available...And they were no help whatsoever for general information about Rome...
reviews.title: Incredibly Noisy...

reviews.text: I stayed here based on Tripadvisor reviews, so I insisted on a room on a lower floor. This was honored, but I made the mistake of getting a single room. These rooms are extemely small, like large closets, with beds much smaller than a twin. It was just passable, but for a larger person it would be impossible.
reviews.title: Good for price & location, but be careful......

reviews.text: The second thing is on both sides of each floor are staircases, and the sound of footsteps and voices can be heard in every room. Folks coming in late at night were not always quiet.
reviews.title: Good.

reviews.text: Otherwise the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the breakfast far better than a normal continental (if you go early or late to get a comfortable seat), and the location superb.
reviews.title: Great location, food, rooms, service...wow!

reviews.text: Whenever we travel to Rome we stay at the Hotel San Carlo. It is quiet, clean, friendly, affordable and, most importantly, right in the heart of where one wants to be when in Rome - within easy walking distance of sites, museums and restaurants. We love Rome and we love it.
reviews.title: Quality Accommodation at Affordable Prices

reviews.text: San carlo Hotel in Rome was great. i spent few nights there and i really like it. Easy to access the taxi can drop infront of the hotel, lovely staff, super clean, and the best location ever. Is located in the heart of rome near all the fashion stores and resturant. room as nice and pepole really good. i had a great time. For sure I will go back there
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel love it

reviews.text: You can't drive up to the front of the hotel, so be prepared to drag your bags a block or more down the cobblestone roads. Rooms are small, which was expected, but are poorly painted and badly marked up. The bathroom has definite odor and is so small and cluttered that it is hard to move in. The hotel's close proximity to the Spanish steps and Piazza del Popolo are it's only redeeming features.
reviews.title: Small, drab rooms with tiny bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In taking our first trip to Rome, we had some concerns about where to stay, language barriers, and safety. We chose to stay at The Hotel San Carlo and not only were we pleased, we were thrilled! The staff at Hotel San Carlo could not have done anything else to make our stay more wonderful. The hotel is lovely, located in the best area for sightseeing and shopping. We walked all over Rome touring the city the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Coliseum, Roman Forum, even a stroll back from Vatican City.
reviews.title: THE place to stay in Rome

reviews.text: Victoria was so kind and helpful she recommended restaurants, even translated a conversation with Italian relatives that came by to visit. Alberto anticipated our every need he made reservations for us and made sure our taxi's were there on time, Rosanna helped us with directions to sights and tours. They never made us feel like a bother, though we had lots of questions. We looked forward to a breakfast of croissants, rolls, cheese, fresh fruits, cereals and delicious cappuccino served with a smile to start the day by Antonella , Marina, and Lina on the beautiful rooftop garden. We stayed 5 days, left for 4 and when we returned Dante carried our bags to our room which was upgraded to a larger room with a lovely balcony, just beautiful! Everyone made us feel so welcome, like honored guests. We cannot wait to go back one day. We would recommend this as THE place to stay in Rome, you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Great Hotel In Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel San Carlo is situated by the Spanish steps between the 2 of the main shopping streets (Via Condetti & El Corso)
reviews.title: Well located hotel, fair price for what you get in this expensive city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideally placed for loads of great restaurants, buses at the end of the street and the metro (grim).
reviews.title: Overall, fantastic hotel

reviews.text: We were in the main hotel building and specified this on the booking.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a top floor (4th) room that was really nice in fact there was a double bed and single bed in separate rooms within the room.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no lift in the main building and the stairs were steep so this is not the hotel for you if you are not fit.
reviews.title: Wonderful!!

reviews.text: One of the best hotels in Rome. We travel frequently in Rome , so we have tried different hotels, but this is in our opinion the most successful. Excellent match between quality and price. The hotel is within walking distance of all major attractions. As you know Rome is very lively and bustling city so also one of the advantage is that the hotel is located on a quiet little street, which allows you to sleep without the noise. The main plus is the hotel's helpful personnel which is always ready to help with everything you need. Clean comfortable rooms and nice breakfast on the veranda, what else is needed.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in Rome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked online a superior double. Before booking, I called & spoke w Vittoria.Told her I was a smoker, & wanted a room with a terrace. She suggested that instead I should ask for a renovated room, & could use the roof top to smoke. I went with her suggestion & wrote all of this in my reservation request.The week previous to our arrival, we were in Rome for the day.We went to the hotel & again reiterated our request, & were told it was not a problem The day of our arrival, I again made my request clear. We were given a room that was in no way a superior room. It was not a renovated room or one with a terrace. The man at the desk said this was all that was available. The bathroom was so small that if we had any girth, we would not have fit between the sink & the tub. We understand the size of rooms in the center of Rome, as my husband is Italian, & we divide out time between the US & Italy. DO NOT recommend.
reviews.title: Not the place to stay!!!!!

reviews.text: I vas there twice. Really very good hotel in very good place. Now they have awesome roof garden.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: Linkejimai nuo Evaldo
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a very good location,- near spanish stairs. The accomodation is perferct - very clean, smells wonderfull and the personell is very helpfull. But the main influence on my opinion about hotel, made a Hude terrase of the hotel. From the terrase opens the view of Roma architecture. In the terrase you feel like you really take from your life the best thigs!!!!
reviews.title: It keeps getting better!

reviews.text: Hotel is situated in the centre of Rome, just 5 minutes away from the Spanish stairs, service is okish but lacks the service of an elevator.
reviews.title: Excellent Location but needs to improve

likes.liked: — What I disliked is the fact that the hotel has no elevator, too hard to beleive that a hotel does not offer the service of an elevator in the heart of Rome. - BIG LET DOWN!!!!

reviews.text: We were allocated a room on the 4th floor, so had to go 4 flight of stairs at least twice a day.
reviews.title: Good hotel in ideal location

reviews.text: * Hotel staff are friendly.
reviews.title: Great Hotel -Location Fantastic

likes.liked: — Great central location in good area and friendly staff
likes.disliked: — No Lift - though good porter service for luggage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2002, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * B'fast can improve.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, decent prices, BEST LOCATION!

likes.disliked: — No elevator...it can be a bit of a climb, depending on what floor you're on (we were on the 5th by US standards)

reviews.text: * Rooms need a refurbishment, as mostly all the furniture is scratched and tiles on the floor need to be replaced (cracked).
reviews.title: Loved Rome

likes.disliked: — Little noisey at times because all floors are tiles, no carpets
